This is an application for Unemployment Insurance. Intentionally submitting false information to obtain benefits is a criminal act.
Any violation will result in prosecution under KRS.331.370(2).

YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ACCURACY OF ALL OF YOUR ANSWERS

To File Your Kentucky Unemployment Claim You Will Need:

Personal Information

  • Date of birth
  • Complete mailing address
  • Phone number
  • Alien registration number if not a US Citizen

Employment Information for the Last 18 Months

  • Employer name
  • Employer address
  • Employer phone number
  • Start and end dates

Other Information

  • List of state(s) you worked in other than Kentucky in the past 18 months
  • Standard Form 8 and/or 50 if worked for Federal Government in the past 18 months
  • DD214 member 4 if served in US Military in the past 18 months

If you do not have this information, exit the system, gather required information and return to this site to continue the claim filing process.

IMPORTANT DATES!


There are two important time periods when filing a claim: Base Period and Benefit Year

Based on today's date, your dates are as follows:

Base Period Date Benefit Year Date
Start Date %g01_base_period_start_date% Effective Date %g01_effective_date%
End Date %g01_base_period_end_date% End Date %mr_byed%

Your wages/earnings in the Base Period determine your weekly benefit amount.
Your Base Period is the first four of the last five calendar quarters immediately prior to the quarter in which you file your claim.
If you do not have sufficient earnings in your Base Period, you may not qualify for benefits.


The Benefit Year Effective Date is the Sunday of the week in which you complete your claim.
The Benefit Year End Date (or BYE) is approximately 1 year after the Effective Date.
Should you qualify for benefits, you will be mailed your weekly benefit amount, which is valid until your BYE.

If you are found payable, you should receive payment within 3-4 business days after requesting your benefits.
You must make your request for benefits on the date you are given at the completion of filing your claim and every 2 weeks thereafter.


Information about direct deposit:

  • You can confirm deposit of your unemployment insurance benefits by contacting your bank
  • New or changed direct deposits will result in one paper check for the first 2 week period after submission
  • Should the bank not be able to process the deposited funds into the specified account, the claimant is responsible for any resulting bank fees
  • The authorization to deposit funds into the provided account will remain in effect until the claimant initiates a change

IF YOU ARE FOUND PAYABLE, YOUR BENEFITS ARE TAXABLE.


Unemployment insurance benefits are taxable and must be reported on your income tax return.
OET will report the total amount of your benefits to the Internal Revenue Service and will provide you with an annual statement (Form 1099G), no later than January 31st of each year.


You may elect to have 10%% of your benefits withheld for federal taxes and 4%% withheld for state taxes.
This is optional and may be changed once during your benefit year.

control.attribute-text: the claimant was eligible to receive workers compensation benefits during the base period
control.question-text: Was the claimant eligible to receive workers compensation benefits during the base period?
control.caption: Did you receive, or were you eligible to receive, Workers' Compensation benefits between %g01_base_period_start_date% and %g01_base_period_end_date%?

You have indicated that you were eligible to receive Workers' Compensation sometime between %g01_base_period_start_date% and %g01_base_period_end_date%.

If you did receive or were eligible to receive Worker's Compensation between these dates you will need to provide documentation showing the dates of eligibility. This documentation should include either a letter from Workers' Compensation showing your dates of eligibility or all paystubs received during your period of eligibility. You should be able to obtain this from your employer’s insurance carrier or Workers' Compensation.

Please fax the requested Workers' Compensation documentation directly to Unemployment Insurance Benefits, Attention: State and Federal Claims at (502) 564-5623.

If you have any questions regarding this matter, please feel free to contact your nearest Kentucky Career Center Office. If you live outside of Kentucky, please contact the Interstate Office.

Failure to report this information within 10 days may delay the processing of your claim or result in the denial of benefits. Thank you for your cooperation.

Intentionally submitting false information is a criminal act. Any violation will result in prosecution under KRS.341.370 (2).

You may access the Rights and Responsibilities pamphlet (PAM-UI-400) by clicking here or at your local Unemployment Insurance Office.


Effective January 1, 2012, Kentucky Unemployment Insurance law requires a one week waiting period per Benefit Year. Your waiting period week will be your first payable week.
If you are found eligible for benefits you will request benefits for two week periods, however your first check will only be for one week.

If you do not agree, please logout or close the window and your claim will not be processed.
In order to successfully complete your claim, you must agree to rights and responsibilities
